definition: to dispel (doubts, misgivings etc)/to give up on
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
to disappear/to vanish/to eliminate/to spend (time)/have to/need

sentences.english: That’s how negative people could drain your positive energy.
sentences.chinese: 這就是消極的人如何打消掉你的積極性了。

sentences.english: If you can't help him, you'd better put him off.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不能幫忙，最好讓人家打消念頭。

sentences.english: She later plans to commit suicide but she drops the idea due to her unborn child.
sentences.chinese: 可是，當她想到腹中孩子，即打消了輕生念頭。

sentences.english: I aborted the idea to retreat and booked the retest for him.
sentences.chinese: 我打消了放棄的念頭併爲他預約了重考。

sentences.english: The teacher drubbed those silly notions out of the student's head.
sentences.chinese: 老師反反覆覆地講得學生打消了愚蠢想法。

sentences.english: That view effectively quashed market speculation of a near-term ECB rate hike and sent the Euro reeling.
sentences.chinese: 這樣的觀點有效打消了有關央行近期加息的猜測。

sentences.english: But, the 80-year-old Mr. Murdoch sought to dispel such ideas.
sentences.chinese: 但80歲的默多克試圖打消外界的傳聞。

sentences.english: so that cut that plan out, and plus it's a lot of money too.
sentences.chinese: 所以就打消了這個念頭，再說要花那麼多錢。

sentences.english: What Confucius said couldn't dissuade Yanhui yet. He went on saying, "I will be upright inside and deferential outside."
sentences.chinese: 顏回要去衛國的決心並沒有因爲老師這一席話而打消。

sentences.english: We have reasoned her out of her wish to be married to a foreigner.
sentences.chinese: 我們通過講道理勸她打消嫁給外國人的願望。

sentences.english: Sometimes we just give up and move on.
sentences.chinese: 有時候我們只好打消了問路的念頭繼續趕路。

sentences.english: Li Boliang want to return to the crystal Yang Ming, to dispel his suspicion of their own.
sentences.chinese: 李博亮欲將血晶還給楊明，以打消他對自己的懷疑。

sentences.english: Lack of cash foced us to scrap plans for a new house.
sentences.chinese: 我們現款不足，只好打消買房子的念頭。

sentences.english: Nobody can beat the idea out of her head.
sentences.chinese: 誰都無法叫她打消這個念頭。
他的勸解打消了我的疑慮。

sentences.english: I don't know, " I replied dryly , trying to discourage him."
sentences.chinese: “我不知道”我聲音乾巴地回答，試圖打消他的熱情。

definition: to persuade/to convince/to talk sb over/Taiwan pr. [shui4 fu2]
to burgeon/to produce/to conceive/to be in the initial stage
to sway/to waver/to rock/to rattle/to destabilize/to pose a challenge to
way of thinking/opinion/notion/to think of a way (to do sth)/CL:個|个[ge4]
to turn to (sth else)/to switch to
